Case reference: 2022057802.CaseDesc: On October 15, 2022, Kirk Allan Boucher was last seen walking without shoes in the area of the Highway 11 and 71 junction in Manitou Rapids Indian Reserve No. 11 in the Rainy River District, Ontario.

Shoes: Light Blue, Bandaged up, slip on hospital booties

Case reference: 2014005441.CaseDesc: On April 23, 2010, Roland Enabulele was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. Roland had taken a trip to Spain and has last spoken with his ex-wife on May 3. During that conversation, Roland advised her that he would be returning to Toronto on May 5, but never returned.

Case reference: 2014005752.CaseDesc: On the early morning of March 31, 2007, Candace Shpeley was last seen in Chilliwack, British Columbia. There is reason to believe that Ms. Shpeley, a resident of Abbotsford, British Columbia, was travelling from a friend’s residence on the day of her disappearance. Her vehicle, a 1995 green Pontiac Grand Am, was recovered near the Renfrew sky train station in Vancouver, British Columbia.

Case reference: 2006010899.CaseDesc: Larry Zink left his home in Delavan, Wisconsin, USA. Family members have indicated that he may have been depressed.  In October 1995, Mr. Zink's vehicle was located unoccupied in a gravel pit 65 km north of Pickle Lake, Ontario.  Mr. Zink has not been seen since.

Teeth: False, Upper teeth and partial bottom teeth - front bottom teeth are his own

Case reference: 2012020119.CaseDesc: On September 10, 1989, Francois Willey was seen for the last time in Chateauguay, Quebec. François has not been seen or heard from since.

Mark: Front Of Neck, Birthmark under Adam’s apple

Case reference: 2014006627.CaseDesc: On November 9, 2012, Andria Meise was reported missing from Kelowna, British Columbia. Andria was last seen in Grande Prairie, Alberta between July 2010 and September 2010. Andria was known to be living a high risk lifestyle and traveled between Grande Prairie, Dawson Creek, Fort St. John, Kelowna and Vancouver.

Case reference: 2012020170.CaseDesc: An adult male was washed up along the south side of the beach at Stanley Park, near the 2000 block of Beach Avenue at English Bay in Vancouver.

Wallet: Black, Contained pliers and a jack knife
Mark: Forehead, Post mortem abrasion on the right side of the forehead

Case reference: 2014004543.CaseDesc: Marguerite Cardwell was last seen in Calgary, AB on Sept. 10, 1973, when she told a friend that she was planning on travelling to either Edmonton or Vancouver. Her vehicle was found near Canmore, AB on Sept. 16, 1973. Her purse and other personal belongings were found inside the vehicle.

Fractured/Broken Bones: Left Ankle, 2 inch screw in ankle

Case reference: 2014001837.CaseDesc: On September 29, 1979 at approximately 8:30 a.m. seven men departed from Anama Bay, Manitoba on a fishing trip. The men departed as a group in three separate boats and were heading for Warpath. At approximately 7:30 p.m. that same day, the occupants of the first boat reported to the RCMP that the other two boats were missing. They described the waves as being three to four feet high and they could not see the tree line from where they were. They lost sight of the other two boats and fired shotgun shots into the air hoping for a response. No response was received. Extensive patrols by air, boat and land were made in an attempt to locate the remaining five men. The bodies of Fredrick Ursu and Jerry Hudy were never recovered. Mr. Ursu and Mr. Hudy are presumed dead due to drowning.

Case reference: 2014002305.CaseDesc: On January 24, 1983, Dennis Howe was seen for the last time at his place of work at 333 Spadina Avenue in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014002313.CaseDesc: On April 5, 1986 Donald Smith was observed in the area of the Whirlpool Bridge in Niagara Falls, Ontario. At the time of his disappearance Donald was despondent and had trouble walking due to arthritis.

Teeth: False, Upper dentures and missing teeth
Amputation: Left Index Finger, Tip of left index missing

Case reference: 1996000260.CaseDesc: On March 17, 1995, Jay Boyle, Michael Cummings, Daniel Higgins, Jamie Lefebvre, Robert Rumbolt, and Chad Smith were seen for the last time walking towards the East Shore Marina in Pickering, Ontario. It is believed that the six young men boarded a boat that subsequently capsized.

Shoes: Red, Sneakers, Sneakers made of suede
Scar: Ears, Piercing scar on left ear

Hat: Black, Baseball hat-" Detroit Red Wings"

Shoes: Canvas, Black, White, Running shoes, brand "Adidas"

Case reference: 2020006272.CaseDesc: On October 27, 1962, at approximately midnight, Ton Hian Tan was last seen leaving his residence in Toronto, Ontario. Ton Hian had left his home with two other men.

Coat: Dark Blue, Blazer, McGill University crest on the pocket

Case reference: 2017015824.CaseDesc: On March 24, 2017, Hua Guo was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2006021899.CaseDesc: De Qian Rang was last seen on April 20, 1992 in the Village of Elora, Ontario. At the time of her disappearance De Qian and her husband operated the 'Abacus Restaurant', south of Elora. An extensive police investigation has failed to locate Mrs. Rang.  Police suspect foul play in her disappearance.

Case reference: 2012020042.CaseDesc: On August 2, 1991, Jennifer Anne Regan was seen for the last time in Calgary, Alberta.

Fractured/Broken Bones: Left Chest, Collar bone, according to medical records from 1985
Left Wrist, According to medical records from 1985

Case reference: 2014004447.CaseDesc: On October 13th, 2002, Yvonne King was reported missing from the community of Fox Harbour, Placentia Bay. Yvonne was last seen walking in the community.

Case reference: 2014005595.CaseDesc:
On April 17, 2011, at approximately 5:00 p.m., Sarah Davis was seen for the last time as she left the 
Juliette’s Place shelter in Toronto, Ontario. Sarah had gone there to retrieve her personal belongings.

Case reference: 2009005299.CaseDesc: David Chevrier suffers from schizophrenia and functions at a low intellectual level. He was last seen at the Centre of Friends on Main street in North Bay.

Case reference: 2014006374.CaseDesc: Rosalie Jean ALLAN was last seen at the end of November, start of December 2013, in Abbotsford, British Columbia.

Case reference: 2011005799.CaseDesc: On June 20, 2011 Ibrahim Sendaigre was driving on Highway 17 between Terrace Bay and Marathon, Ontario.  He was involved in a motor vehicle accident and fled the scene into the bush area. Police searches of the area yielded negative results. Mr. Sendaigre has not been located and has had no contact with family or friends. Last Seen: Highway 17, Tuuri Township.  Approximately 4 km west of the Steel River bridge near Black Fox Lake.  This area is essentially located between the towns of Marathon and Terrace Bay, in Northwestern Ontario.

Case reference: 2014006333.CaseDesc: Deanne MacNeil was last seen on video surveillance at the Mundare Liquor Store during the early morning hours of November 28, 2013.

Case reference: 2012020045.CaseDesc: The RCMP is seeking assistance in locating Shirley Ann WAQUAN. She was last seen on July 1, 2007 in Fort McMurray.

Case reference: 2020013833.CaseDesc: On May 6, 2020, Dylan Ehler was seen for the last time as he wandered off in Truro, Nova Scotia. Following his disappearance, Dylan’s rubber boots were discovered in a nearby brook by divers. This brook flows into a river that flows with the Bay of Fundy.

Jacket: Dark Green, Camo with fur around the hood

Case reference: 2014003255.CaseDesc: On September 06, 1976, Charles Lewsaw was seen for the last time near Newmack well site located 8 km North of Red Earth Creek, Alberta.

Foreign Object: Right Forearm, Rod in arm from elbow to wrist

Case reference: 2022041871.CaseDesc: On June 20, 1994, Johnny Baker was seen for the last time at his residence in Borger Texas, USA.

Scar: Left Eye, Over the left eye

Case reference: 2012020013.CaseDesc: Angeline Pete was last seen on May 26, 2011 leaving her residence in North Vancouver, BC.  Miss Pete's disappearance is suspicious and foul play cannot be excluded.

Hair: Brown, Long, Dyed, Often dyes it

Case reference: 2007002999.CaseDesc: Luciano Trinaistich was last seen at his residence on the 24th of July 2007 where he left and indicated that he was going to pick blueberries along Murphy Road near Timmins, Ontario. When he did not return home his wife contacted the Timmins Police Service and reported him missing. A search was conducted by the Timmins Police Service and the Ontario Provincial Police which resulted in locating the missing male's vehicle parked down a sideroad that runs off of Murphy Road. An extensive ground search has been conducted in the vicinity of the recovered vehicle with negative results.

Case reference: 2005001599.CaseDesc: Shawn Jones and Leslie Jones were seen on October 24, 1993. The two boys were hitchhiking from Cape Croker to Wiarton. They were dropped off in downtown Wiarton. Between October 26-28, 1993 Leslie Jones was seen with another male fitting the description of Shawn Jones. They were seen together at the Tim Hortons coffee shop in Owen Sound, Ontario. Shawn Jones was last seen on Berford Street in front of Pacific Hotel. Leslie Jones was last seen in front of the Tim Horton's restaurant on 9th East Street.

Case reference: 2012020036.CaseDesc: On April 20, 2009, at approximately 5:00 p.m., Monique Mattar was seen for the last time in the northeast community of Greenview in Calgary, Alberta. During the time of her disappearance, Monique was leading a high-risk lifestyle.

Case reference: 2014004857.CaseDesc: On September 21, 1992, David Neufeld, Peter Bentzen and Kenneth Vaughan were seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. The three men had been associating with each other as “runners” in order to smuggle cigarettes into Canada from the United States by means of a boat. David’s vehicle and boat trailer were located at Ashbridges Bay, Toronto. The aging boat that was borrowed from a friend has never been recovered and the three men have not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2014006184.CaseDesc: On October 15, 1977, Jacques Chaput left the family home in Trois-Rivières, Quebec following a disagreement he had with his mother and he never returned. Numerous steps were taken by his family to locate him, but they were unsuccessful. Jacques was officially declared missing by his family in 2013.

Case reference: 2014004013.CaseDesc: On September 25, 1997, Eric Pouliot said he was departing to go up north for a maximum of 48 hours, but he never returned. He had little money and no vehicle. At the time of his disappearance, Eric lived in the LeMoyne district of Longueuil, Quebec for one week.

Case reference: 2014005278.CaseDesc: On July 14, 2009, Yashpal Mehay left his residence in Surrey BC, and was scheduled to travel to Clinton BC, where he co-owned and operated a Petro Canada Gas Station with family. Yashpal Mehay was last seen at the Costco in Abbotsford BC, at 1450 hours on July 14, 2009, where he purchased tobacco, food and gas. Mr. Mehay failed to arrive at his destination in Clinton BC, and there has been no communication with the family. He was very familiar with this route as he travelled it every other week. The Surrey RCMP has conducted extensive searches along the travelled route with negative results.

Shirt: Green, White, Long sleeve "American Eagle" polo

Case reference: 2014003950.CaseDesc: Lyndon Fuller was last seen on November 25, 1988, in the area of the local hospital in Berwick, Nova Scotia. Lyndon had jumped from a third floor window following his admission to the hospital. Lyndon left on foot in an unknown direction.

Case reference: 2014004217.CaseDesc: On May 7, 1968, Bernice Redhead, her brother and their parents were on the back of a dogsled which was being led by their grandfather. The group was traveling on God's River when they broke through the ice. All passengers fell into the water.   The grandfather was able to pull everyone to safety with the exception of Bernice, who was taken away by the swift moving current of the river. Bernice has not been located.

Case reference: 2020011563.CaseDesc: On July 17, 1988, at approximately 12:00pm, Mosses Korman was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2008016999.CaseDesc: Meryl Newcombe and George Weeden were last seen and reported missing to the White River OPP on October 29, 1959. The two men had been at a lodge operated by Mr. Newcombe at Mile 107 of the CPR line, west of Chapleau, Ontario. Mr. Weeden and Mr. Newcombe had planned a hunting trip and both were last seen between mile marker 106 and 107 of the CPR line southeast of White River and west of Chapleau. A large-scale search was conducted at the time, and again in the following spring (1960).  The search failed to locate the two men, and to date, they have not been located. Mr. Weeden exact date of birth is not known, but his year of birth is understood to be 1896 or 1897.

Fractured/Broken Bones: Right Leg, injured in a train wreck in 1941

Case reference: 2014001826.CaseDesc: On November 5, 1960, Andrew Moses was last seen as he left his base camp on Brunswick Lake in Algoma County, Ontario. Andrew had left the base camp to check his trap line, which was approximately 5 miles in length near Ericson Creek. On November 13, 1960, a small search group was formed when Andrew did not return. The group located a rifle belonging to Andrew leaning against a tree. The following day, a half eaten beaver was located inside of a nearby camp on Ericson creek. The camp and trap line were searched one year later, and it revealed that it was vacant with no signs of being visited.

Case reference: 2006002199.CaseDesc: On September 23, 1994, this Caucasian male, was found in a field on the south side of the Rogers Centre (formerly known as the SkyDome) at the far end of Rees Street in Toronto. His post-mortem length was approximately 6’2" and he weighed 162lbs, however, these measurements may not represent his actual living weight and height due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy.

Teeth: Missing several teeth; had a great deal of restorative work done in the past with multiple silver-amalgam restorations

Case reference: 2014002445.CaseDesc: On April 9, 1998, Elaine Dumba was reported missing from Coquitlam, British Columbia. However, Ms. Dumba’s family have not seen or heard from her since April 9, 1989.

Case reference: 2018005079.CaseDesc: Joshua Hawkins was last seen on January 28, 2018, at approximately 6pm when he left the Brockville General Hospital without being discharged.

Tattoo: Right Calf, Lion and dragon with the word Kaitlyn
Right Upper Arm, Outline of a heart
Right Leg, Skull and hand holding a flame - on the front of the leg

Case reference: 2017019146.CaseDesc: On April 12, 2017, Hélène Martineau was seen for the last time when she left her home in the Ste-Thérèse sector in Jonquière, Quebec. Hélène has not been seen or heard from since.

Boots: Grey, Blue, Merrel brand, walking shoe

Case reference: 2014001757.CaseDesc: On January 12, 1987, Patricia Hutton was seen for the last time in the Saint-Léonard district of Montreal, Quebec. She had an appointment at a daycare center on the corner of Beaubien and Langelier for a job, but never attended. Patricia hasn’t been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2014002684.CaseDesc: On February 16, 1994, Mathieu Landry was reported missing by a traveling companion. Mr. Landry was renting a cabin at Juara village on Tioman Island in Malaysia when he went for a walk and never returned. Sunglasses belonging to Landry where found on the beach. His passport, clothing, backpack and other personal effects where recovered from the resort where he was staying. Land and water searches involving police divers where done and failed to locate him; he was presumed to have drowned.

Case reference: 2014006285.CaseDesc: Philippe Guerin was reported missing from the North Bay Psychiatric Hospital on June 12, 1966. He is paralyzed on the left side as a result of having Polio at 10 years of age. He is missing his upper teeth.

Case reference: 2014003425.CaseDesc: Christopher Giberson, went missing from the Saint John Regional Hospital on Friday, January 28th, 2000, at 7:00 p.m. where he was taken for treatment and then assessment, but he walked away before being seen by staff.

Case reference: 2014003787.CaseDesc: Jo Ann Comeau, was last seen on February 9th, 2001, in Saint John, NB. Joanne suffers from Muscular Dystrophy and walks with an unsteady gait.

Case reference: 2019024246.CaseDesc: On May 6, 2019, Daniel Richards was seen for the last time in the area of Niagara Falls, Ontario. Niagara Police responded to a report of a man that had jumped into the falls. The police were able to obtain a description and a photograph of the man who was identified as Daniel. His vehicle was located abandoned in the nearby area.

Case reference: 2006009699.CaseDesc: Dwayne Lee left his residence on December 24th,1999. His vehicle was located December 26, 1999, at Gray's Beach, Thousand Island's Parkway in the Township of Leeds and Thousand Islands.

Case reference: 2014001664.CaseDesc: On September 12, 1982, Harold Larcher and his girlfriend set out in separate canoes with their supplies. Both canoes displayed their own leaks. After the river, they saw waves on the lake. The canoes began filling with water from these same waves.  Harold's girlfriends’ canoe sunk but she could see he was still in his canoe as she was struggling to right her own. She was unable to do so, but at one point was able to sit on top of it. Eventually she made her way to shore, however she did not see Harold again.  Numerous personal items belonging to Harold were recovered including his Passport and a life jacket that could have been his.  It is presumed Mr.Larcher drowned.

Case reference: 2014046775.CaseDesc: On November 10, 2014, at approximately 2:00 p.m., Sofia Touila was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. Sofia had told her friend that she would be going home but did not return.

Case reference: 2020008363.CaseDesc: On August 16, 1981, at approximately 1:00pm, Dick Yeagar was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. Dick had been evicted from his apartment on August 15, and did not show up to work the following day.

Case reference: 2014005144.CaseDesc: On August 26, 2008, Esther De Kiewit was reported missing after her mail was not being picked up from the Post Office in Boston Bar, British Columbia. She led a transient lifestyle and was living in an abandoned travel trailer in a forested area outside of Boston Bar. Esther moved throughout the back country frequently and is believed to have last been at her trailer in April of 2008. Esther suffered from mental health issues and seizures.  She was known to dress entirely in black.

Case reference: 2015011636.CaseDesc: On June 20, 1998, a fisherman saw the body of a man floating in the St. Lawrence River in front of L'île aux Vaches.

Socks: White, Grey, white top and gray on bottom
Tattoo: Right Shoulder, sword and a cross

Case reference: 2008004899.CaseDesc: Fernand Martin, also known as Fernand Boutin, last seen on the 24th April, 1964 when he visited the outpost at the north end of the Pakashkan Lake.  He was tending to his traplines in the bush near Pakashkan Lake.

Jacket: Animal Skin, light doe skin jacket
Shirt: size 33 shirt with a 15.5 inch neck

Case reference: 2007003099.CaseDesc: Christina Calayca was camping with friends at Rainbow Falls Provincial Park located near Schreiber, Ontario. At approximately 6:30 am Ms. Calayca indicated to a friend that she was going jogging and was last observed on a park campground roadway. Ms. Calayca never returned to her campsite and has not been heard from since. An extensive ground and air search has been conducted by the Ontario Provincial Police but Ms. Calayca has not been located.

Case reference: 2014006747.CaseDesc: Jian Ping Li and her 6 month old baby, Xiao Feng Lu, were last seen at their family residence in Brossard, Quebec on April 30, 2014, around 9:40 a.m. When her husband returned, around 2:30 p.m., there was nobody home and the back door was unlocked.  Jian Ping Li's car was still at the residence. She left without her purse, her wallet, her credit card, her cell phone, money, the diaper bag for the baby, the baby stroller and the car seat.

Case reference: 2012020134.CaseDesc: On the morning of September 4, 2002, Edward Taylor left his residence and took his vehicle to go to work. He has not been seen since. His car was found on September 7, 2002 in a service area of Porte-du-Nord, which is located on the Laurentides highway between Saint-Jérôme and Saint-Sauveur in Quebec.

Shirt: Dark Blue, Long sleeve shirt, navy blue

Case reference: 2014001111.CaseDesc: On February 7th, 1994, the remains of an adult male (25-50 years old), 5'10-6'0 tall, with a thin build, were located by land surveying students in a wooded area near the village of Anmore. The investigation determined the cause of death to be a self-inflicted gunshot wound. A black guitar case was found near the remains. He went missing sometime after May 1992.

Belt: Black, Blue, Fabric belt with a metal Indian Chief Belt buckle inscribed "HARA"
Jacket: Cotton, Blue, Blue with Green Gold piping sleeved Windbreaker Jacket
Pants: Nylon, Blue, Maroon, Sweat pants with zipper on cuffs
Shirt: Cotton, Grey, Black, Long Sleeved Sweatshirt

Case reference: 2012020147.CaseDesc: On March 25, 1996, the skeletal remains of a man were found near the Upper Levels Highway in West Vancouver, British Columbia. The man had recovered from severe injuries to his right arm and leg. He also had a fractured skull, nose and ribs. These injuries were likely a result of a single major accident. It is estimated that he may have died several months prior to the discovery of his remains.

Jacket: Corduroy, Purple, Lavender, Mauve, 3/4 length coat with fleece
Fractured/Broken Bones: Left Side Of Head, Recent fracture to the left temporal bone above the left ear
Nose, Old nasal fracture with visible deformity
Deformity: Shoulders, Old injury; no indication of which shoulder

Case reference: 2018012254.CaseDesc: On March 5, 2018, at approximately 10:50am, Mary Owusu was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario.

Coat: Blue, Parka with a fur trimmed hood

Case reference: 2014006380.CaseDesc: Dean Kelly Morrison was last seen October 23, 2013, after being dismissed from his job. His vehicle was left abandoned on a ranch.

Case reference: 2016008425.CaseDesc: Colleen Sylvia Smith was last seen at home, on February 9, 2016, by her ex-boyfriend/landlord.

Case reference: 2014006534.CaseDesc: In May of 1967, Donald Lariviere was seen for the last time at the Pinehouse airstrip in Pinehouse, Saskatchewan. At the time of his disappearance, Donald was accompanied by his father, who was sleeping at this time. When his father awakened, Donald was gone.

Case reference: 2014003363.CaseDesc: At 2:00 a.m. on April 21st, 1992, Hilda BEAUDOIN and her brother left the Beagle Lounge in Mary's Harbour, NL on a single snowmobile to ride across the sea ice near coastal waters in efforts to return to St. Lewis, NL. They did not arrive at their destination. Snowmobile tracks were discovered leading into open water near St. Lewis where the snowmobile and her brother's body were later recovered from the ocean waters.

Case reference: 2016070415.CaseDesc: On December 2, 2016, Houda Doumi left Canada with her two children, Zineb and Rayan Lahrim and connected at the John F. Kennedy Airport in New York City, USA, where they then travelled on to Cairo, Egypt. It is believed that Houda and the children are actually in the United Arab Emirates.

Case reference: 2014003849.CaseDesc: On September 16, 1998, Jocelyne Boardman was seen for the last time when she left a friend's residence in the Verdun District in Montreal, Quebec, to return to her home in Kingston, Ontario. Jocelyne is known to only wear black clothing and she hasn't been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2017047772.CaseDesc: On August 15, 2017, Moacir Ferrari was seen for the last time leaving his home with his belongings in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2019073876.CaseDesc: On November 1, 2019, Anton Katona was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2008003299.CaseDesc: On May 17, 1985, Cyril Cheong was fishing on White Lake with his friends when the weather deteriorated and strong winds started to blow. Mr. Cheong's boat capsized and his friends were unable to save him.  One of his friends saw him, approximately 2 to 3 feet under the water, beyond his reach.

Case reference: 2014001690.CaseDesc: On December 7, 1971, James MacDonald departed Thompson, Manitoba in his "Money Mark 21" aircraft bound for Winnipeg. James never arrived. Despite intensive air search neither Mr. MacDonald nor his aircraft have been located.

Jewelry: Metal, Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, engineering ring
Metal, Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Calendar watch

Case reference: 2014003152.CaseDesc: Sylvain Baril was last seen on May 8, 1999, in Montreal, Quebec.

Tattoo: Chest, Bird on upper left side

Case reference: 1993001330.CaseDesc: Darlene was last seen at home.

Case reference: 2020008549.CaseDesc: On March 26, 1976, at approximately 12:30pm, Licelia D’Costa was last seen by her landlady in Toronto, Ontario. Licelia had told her roommate that she was headed to Ottawa, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014004976.CaseDesc: Beric Bason was last seen on July 22, 2007 at Loon Lake Resort near Clinton, British Columbia.  Beric has not been seen or heard from since and the reason for his disappearance is unknown.

Case reference: 2006007599.CaseDesc: Leland Iseler was last seen October 9, 1967, at a hunt camp on the Mattagami River,  near Cypress Falls, 30 miles north of Smooth Rock Falls.  His boat was found anchored about 100 feet off shore and his fishing rod was missing. Leland Iseler has never been located.

Case reference: 2013000038.CaseDesc: Samuel Lachance was last seen at the Beverage Room in Prince Albert, Saskatchewan near the end of July, 1987. Samuel was in very good physical condition at the time of his disappearance and worked in different logging camps in Saskatchewan. Family members say that it was unusual for Samuel not to have any contact with them or his friends near the time he was last seen.

Case reference: 2022019161.CaseDesc: On May 2, 2022, James Logan was seen for the last time in Stony Plain, Alberta. That same day, James had called a friend for a ride, and was later dropped off at the Rotary Park in Stony Plain. When James left his residence, he did not take any of his personal belongings, including his wallet, glasses, medication, cellphone, and vehicle.

Case reference: 2019033665.CaseDesc: On July 18, 1988, the remains of a male were found in a field on the side of road 132 in Tracy, Québec. A camp was found near the remains.

Case reference: 2014004868.CaseDesc: On May 13, 2004, at approximately 8:00 a.m., Stephen Liou was seen for the last time as he left his home in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2005006599.CaseDesc:
On September 18, 1978, the body of an unidentified man was found in the Toronto Harbour of Lake Ontario. His post-mortem weight was 163lbs and his length was measured at 5'10", however, these measurements may not represent his actual living weight and height due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy.
Staining on his teeth suggest that he may have been a smoker. It is estimated that he had been in the water for several weeks.

Teeth: Stained, Overbite & several amalgam fillings. Several teeth lost/extracted during life; lower right lateral incisor being most obvious.

Case reference: 2018039302.CaseDesc: On February 17, 1992, at approximately 9:00 am, Glen Levy was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. Prior to his disappearance, Glen had attempted to travel by bus to visit his father in Florida, USA.

Coat: Nylon, Black, Parka, green trim, 3/4 length

Case reference: 2014005682.CaseDesc: On September 27, 2011, Bernard Wierzba was seen for the last time as he swam with a friend near the Manola Bridge in Barrhead County, Alberta. During this time, Bernard was not wearing a life jacket and he has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2016066678.CaseDesc: On July 29, 1966, the remains of a male were recovered from the Maid of the Mist Landing, in Niagara Falls. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 175-180 lbs and his length was measured at 5'11", however, these measurements may not represent his actual living weight and height due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy.

Hair: Black, Short, Shorter than collar length, greying

Case reference: 2014005571.CaseDesc: On March 18, 2011, Isabelle Roy-Roland left the Levis Hospital after receiving a permission to leave the grounds. She was never seen again.

Coat: Brown, 3/4 length coat with fur on the hood

Case reference: 2014006541.CaseDesc: Roxanne Fleming has not been seen since approximately 1986.  Around the time of last contact, she spent time in Lillooet, BC, Kamloops, BC, Vancouver, BC, Red Deer, AB, and Edmonton, AB.  The circumstances of her disappearance are unknown.

Case reference: 2016061228.CaseDesc: On June 14, 1970, a male was found floating in Lake Ontario near the mouth of the Humber River. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 201lbs and his length was measured at 5'10", however, these measurements may not represent his actual living weight and height due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. His appendix was present. He is thought to have been in the water for a few days to several days.

Shoes: Black, only the left shoe has laces

Case reference: 2017017369.CaseDesc: On August 5, 1986, the mutilated body of an adult male believed to be between the ages of 20-25 was found on the railway line near Highway 20 in Dorval, Quebec. The man was reportedly seen lying on the railroad tracks.

Case reference: 2023018806.CaseDesc: Richard Duffy was last seen in December 1970 in the area of the Rio Grande River, New Mexico, United States. At the time of his disappearance, Richard was part of the US Marine Corps.

Case reference: 2012020105.CaseDesc: Marilyn Bergeron, has been missing since February 17, 2008, from St-Romuald, Québec.

Boots: Suede, Black, with a fur trimmed contour
Coat: Black, Long coat with a fur hood

Case reference: 2014005017.CaseDesc: On July 7, 1967, Margaret Mildred Batoche was reported missing from her family residence in Bonnyville, Alberta. Margaret always kept in contact with her family and friends, and her disappearance is considered suspicious.

Mark: Cheek, Wart on right cheek close to ear

Case reference: 2005069040.CaseDesc: Yaseen is believed to be with his mother, Marina Zlonikova. They may be in the Ukraine.

Case reference: 2014004732.CaseDesc: Waylon Edwin Smith was last seen in the Lake St. Martin area of Manitoba.  He had lived in Winnipeg and gone to Lake St. Martin to visit family.  He went for a walk and never returned.  He suffered from mental health issues.

Case reference: 2014001072.CaseDesc: On July 19 1984, the body of a male believed to be between the ages of 18-29 was found in the waters of the Fraser River near Boston Bar, British Columbia. He had some crowding on his upper teeth and no tattoos or obvious scars. It is believed he was deceased for a few months prior to his remains being recovered.

Case reference: 2014001471.CaseDesc: Martin Gant had not been seen by his wife since November 27, 1961, when he destined to Corral, Chile in South America to install machinery in a cannery where he had a contract.

Case reference: 2014004580.CaseDesc: On the morning of the 23rd of July 1991, a group of 8 individuals left Igloolik NU. heading to Hall Beach, NU.  The group travelled using a 24 feet freighter canoe powered by a 30 hp outboard.  It was a stormy day with heavy rain.  Approximately 15 miles North of Hall Beach, the canoe hit ice, filled with water and capsized.  Only one occupant made it back to shore.

Case reference: 2014004672.CaseDesc: On the 13th of June, 1995, Marcel Legris and a friend were last seen fishing on Cold Lake, SK. A large storm suddenly came up and it is believed that it swamped the boat they were using. The friend’s body was located, however, Marcel was never found.

Case reference: 2014002434.CaseDesc: On June 25, 1979, Lorraine Legault was seen for the last time as she played in front of the home of her grandparents in Montreal, Quebec.

Case reference: 2014005133.CaseDesc: On August 4, 2008, Laventus Burke was seen for the last time in St. Albans, Newfoundland and Labrador. During the time of his disappearance, Laventus had left a note for his mother indicating that he was going to travel to Alberta for work, and then would be moving to the State of Florida in the United States.
